title.narrative: Advisory support to Syria’s neighborhood Lebanon and Jordan

description.narrative: Under the general direction of the Department for Migration, Stabilization and Fragility (MNS) at the Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Embassy in Beirut, Lebanon, the adviser shall assist in developing and managing partnerships in Lebanon and Jordan related to the Syria crisis. This includes engaging in the strategic development of the international response to the Syria crisis through promoting a coherent approach and synergies across the humanitarian response, development assistance and peace building initiatives. The adviser shall thus participate in relevant coordination bodies, prepare analyses and report on contextual opportunities, risks and challenges, provide technical advice to partners, communicate and follow-up with partners. The adviser is to support in particular a number of partnerships with e.g. civil society organisations; Agence Française de Dévelopement (AFD) and UNHCR in Lebanon, and Jordan Health Fund for Refugees (JHFR), a multi-donor account in Jordan set up to support the inclusion of refugees in the National Health Service. The adviser will be located in Beirut with frequent travel expected to Amman, Jordan.
